publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 73.2

seg.seg: ... wird sehr geschädigt. Das ist sein Leid; es übertrifft alle Leiden.
... is harmed very much. This is his suffering; it surpasses all sufferings.
If someone is hardly even born, certainly he dies afterwards.
Ist einer kaum geboren, [so] stirbt er gewiss späterhin.
One who has just been born will certainly die later on.

Having to be separated from the dear; reunion with the unpleasant; eventually not being able to obtain a thing [long] cherished; [the fact that] things achieved are certainly to perish afterwards—these sorrows are here because of the [re]births.
Wären die Körper nicht für die Menschen in der Welt...
If the bodies were not in the world for the humans...
If the beings in the world had no bodies, they would not undergo bodily pains at all. If there were no mind, pains of the mind would not be there at all in the world either.
Hätten die Menschen in der Welt keine Körper, [so] würden sie gar keine körperlichen Leiden erdulden.
If humans had no bodies in [this] world, they would not undergo any physical suffering at all.

list.item:
Alternative classifications:
Peyrotarchaic I
Malzahn–
TamaiII-1 (600-700)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2-3 If someone is hardly even born, certainly he dies afterwards. 381
a4-6 Having to be separated from the dear; reunion with the unpleasant; eventually not being able to obtain a thing [long] cherished; [the fact that] things achieved are certainly to perish afterwards—these sorrows are here because of the [re]births. 355
b5-6 If the beings in the world had no bodies, they would not undergo bodily pains at all. If there were no mind, pains of the mind would not be there at all in the world either. 329

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1 ... wird sehr geschädigt. Das ist sein Leid; es übertrifft alle Leiden. 511
a2-3 Ist einer kaum geboren, [so] stirbt er gewiss späterhin. 115
b5 Wären die Körper nicht für die Menschen in der Welt... 211, fn. 6
b5-6 Hätten die Menschen in der Welt keine Körper, [so] würden sie gar keine körperlichen Leiden erdulden. 201


additional classification A1

#M12# %7 a1 maka , miyästrä : #12a su cwi|cpi lakle|läkl(e) ste ; po läklenta , ṣärkästrä : #12b – – – wnolmets ; k_use ra tsa ksa , śaiṣṣene : #12c a2 cmelāts ṣärmtsa po ; mäsketär tne , snai sklokä 2 #2d tetemoṣäts po ; kest yokaiṣṣe , lakle|läkle ste : #3a cmetär ka ksa a3 kwri|kr_ui ; nemcek postäṃ , sruketrä : #3b teki ktsaitsäññe ; cmeltse ṣärmtsa , mäsketrä : #3c kektseñ premane ; a4 tau läklenta , wärpnāträ 3 #3d lareṃnmeṃ tsrelle ; anaiwacce«ṃ»mpa , śmälyñe : #4a ritoṣ wändrentse ; mā källalle|källa|lle a5 , postän nai : #4b yainmwa wäntarwāntsä ; nemcek postäṃ , nkelle ste : #4c toṃ läklenta tne ; cmelants ṣärmtsa , mäskenträ a6 4 #4d mentsi kukäṣälyñe ; pälskontse ra , trikalyñe : #5a amiśkäññe ṣpä ; pälwālle śle , /// %3 #5b %2 b1 wärññai tne ; pälskoṣṣāna , läklenta : #5c cm(e)ltse ṣärmtsa po ; wärpänanträ , onolmi|onolymī 5 #5d p· kw· /// %5 b2 kaine , śänmäṣlye : #6a apsāl śakattai ; ṣäp ay ṣesa , pyākälyñe : #6b aścä kärstalyñe ; ṣäneṃ /// %5 #6c b3 tesa wärñai no ; kektseñṣāna , läklenta 6 #6d nraine läklenta ; pretenne śle , lwāsāne : #7a ñäkteṃts|ñäktets śamnantsä ; b4 k_use ra tsa , ksa śaiṣṣene : #7b kätkau|kätkau_u ekmätte ; yneśäññi k_use , läklenta : #7c cmelats ṣärmtsa po ; wärpä b5 nanträ , onolmī 7 #7d kektseñ mā takoṃ ; onolmeṃts|onolmentso , śaiṣṣene : #8a mänta wärponträ ; kektseñṣana , b6 läklenta : #8b pälsko mā tāko_ī ; pälskoṣṣana , läklenta : #8c cek wärñai rano ; mänta takoṃ , śaiṣṣene 8 #8d tusa b7 wñawā ñäś ; po läklen«ta»ts , witsakai|witsäkai : #9a camel|cämel wätkāl ste ; mänta nesäṃ , aleksa : #9b pkarsas|pkärso maimäñci ; pikāt %5 #9c

a1 m[a]ka miyäst_rä : su cp[i] _l_akl(e) ste po _l_aklenta _ṣ_ar_k_ast_r_a : – – – wnolmet_s\ k_use ra tsa ksa śaiṣṣene : a2 cmelāts _ṣärmtsa po _m_aske_t_a_r\ tne snai sklo_k_a 2 tetemo_ṣ_ats po kest yokaiṣṣe _l_akle ste : cme_t_ar ka ksa a3 kr_ui nemcek pos_t_aṃ sruket_r_a : teki ktsait_s_aññe cmeltse _ṣ_armtsa _m_asket_r_a : kektseñ premane a4 tau _l_aklenta wä[r]pnāt_r_a 3 lareṃnmeṃ tsrelle anaiwaccempa śmälyñe : ritoṣ wändrentse mā _k_all[a] a5 lle pos_tän nai : yainmwa wäntarwāntsä nemcek pos_t_aṃ nkelle ste : toṃ _l_aklenta tne cmelants _ṣ_armtsa _m_askent_r_a a6 4 mentsi ku[_k_a]_ṣ_alyñe _p_alskontse ra trikalyñe : amiś_k_aññe _ṣ_p_a _p_alwālle śle /// b1 wärññai tne _p_alskoṣṣāna _l_aklenta : [c]m(e)ltse _ṣ_armtsa po wär_p_anant_r_a onolym[ī] 5 [p· kw·] /// b2 kaine _ś_anmäṣlye : apsāl śakattai _ṣ_ap ay [ṣ]esa pyā_k_alyñe : aścä _k_arstalyñe _ṣ_a[neṃ] /// b3 tesa wärñai no kektseñṣāna _l_aklenta 6 nraine _l_aklenta pretenne śle lwāsāne : ñäktets śamnant_s_a b4 k_use ra tsa ksa śaiṣṣene : _k_atkau_u e_k[_m_a]tte yne_ś_aññi k_use _l_aklenta : cmelats _ṣ_armtsa po wär_p_a b5 nant_r_a onolmī 7 kektseñ mā takoṃ onolmentso śaiṣṣene : _m_anta wärpont_r_a kektseñṣana b6 _l_aklenta : _p_alsko mā tāko_ī _p_alskoṣṣana _l_aklenta : cek wärñai rano _m_anta takoṃ śaiṣṣene 8 tusa b7 wñawā ñä_ś\ po _l_aklents wit_s_akai : cäme_l\ wätkā_l\ ste mänta [n]e_s_aṃ aleksa : p_k_arso mai_m_añci pikā_t\
